game_description: 6 Level Demo of "ZOSULand 20ZZ" - about 1.5 miles of future cities + bonus lobby (compare to Full Game with 36 levels and 10 miles of cities) -Timed mode: 2 min per level, total 12 min total gameplay -Freeplay mode -Climb, fly, grapple futuristic urban areas to save each floating city and save many animals that live there (Full Game has Over 250 building types to explore, over 40 types of animals to save) - Jetpacks allow flight, grapples in each level available, climb almost anything anywhere
review_1: I've played terrible VR games before, but they always have something to counter the con. But this game doesn't. It lacks in graphics, gameplay and story. The gravity's code in this game is the worst, and you couldn't have done a kill animation? I also wouldn't recommend it for someone who wants story then anything else. You do things with no context, And what is up with the animals in this game? The grappling hook is the worst. I love your concept, but it was executed on a Windows xp. Meta, please don't add it to the store. Also, it's really laggy if you needed to know.
review_2: I wanted to love this game. The graphics are phenomenal. You start hanging somewhere in the air without knowing what to do. There is an objective, which was nice but nothing seemed to work as indicated, and there wasn’t enough instructions. Like how you cannot let go of the “jets.” And then all of a sudden while trying to figure out how to play, a countdown starts and at the end you are “behind the curtain.” I hope they fix this because the idea and the graphics are very good. I look forward to updates. Another issue I encountered was sometimes touching an animal with the right hand would do nothing.
review_3: This was a unique experience with large levels. Fun once I learned how to play and climb large towers
